**Expected Return without Leverage**



```{r}
#| eval: true
#| results: asis
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
library(webexercises)
set.seed(1001)
value_strong <- rnorm(1, mean = 600, sd = 3)
value_weak <- rnorm(1, mean = 300, sd = 3)
prob_strong <- 0.5
prob_weak <- 0.5
market_value_today <- rnorm(1, mean = 400, sd = 3)
expected_future_value <- prob_strong * value_strong + prob_weak * value_weak
expected_return <- (expected_future_value - market_value_today) / market_value_today * 100
```

A company has no debt. Its assets will be worth `r round(value_strong, 1)` million in one year if the economy is strong, but only `r round(value_weak, 1)` million if the economy is weak. Both events are equally likely.   The current market value of the company’s assets is `r round(market_value_today, 1)` million.   Compute the **expected return without leverage (in %)**.


::: {.question-block}
